intro: Mapouria tricephala, commonly known as the three-headed mapouria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences, which give it the common name due to the appearance of three heads. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, while the flowers are small and white or pink in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
